headline: Poppyseed Dressing
description: This poppyseed dressing is slightly thick, sweet and tangy. It takes only minutes to make and is a wonderful complement to almost any salad!
name: Poppyseed Dressing

recipeInstructions.text: Place vinegar, sugar, onion, mustard, and salt into a blender or food processor; blend for 20 seconds. With the blender running, gradually add oil in a thin steady stream until combined.
Transfer dressing to a bowl and stir in poppy seeds.

review.reviewBody: I Love this dressing. It's so easy. I've had so many compliments on my spinach salads using spinach, strawberries, apple, (or any fruits) and toasted sliced almonds. It's my go to salad for potlucks. However I do substitute Apple Cider vinegar for the red wine vinegar.
This is the perfect recipe for a summer salad with strawberries, blueberries, candied pecans and goat cheese over mixed greens. I've subbed out some dijon for the dry mustard and it's just as good.

So easy to make with ingrédients that you would normally have in your kitchen. Thanks to the many reviews I used half red wine vinegar and half cider vinegar. Also, cut back on half of the oil. Like many others, I préfère homemade salad dressings as they containers zéro cheminais or préservatives. It's delicious and really costs so much less that grocery store dressings. Served mine over green salad with chopped up chicken thigh.
Great with spinach, boiled eggs, mandarin oranges, craisins, pecans and feta cheese. Grating onions is harder than I thought it would be. 3/1/22
Wouldn't change a thing! Delicious! For about 60cents I saved 4 from the grocery list and Soooooo good!
Great dressing for salad with strawberries. I used half rice vinegar and half white vinegar to cut the acidity and used half the sugar.

I love it! Although I cut the vinegar just a little this recipe is great for making green apple coleslaw! All you do is add julianed green apples And poppyseed dressing to a bag of coleslaw mix.

I would make a much smaller amount next time.

Was really easy to put together. I used half olive oil and half canola oil. Put the poppy seeds in with the other ingredients (rather than after blinding. Stored in the fridge for a couple of hours and it was great.
I went exactly by the recipe. This dressing has a nice balance of flavors. It was the perfect compliment to the salad.

Delicious!

I also used Grapeseed oil again, to keep the feel very light but did have to add a bit more than the recipe called for. I served it on an orange, Mango and Jicama salad. Wonderful and everyone loved it.
Loved this dressing!! The only change I made was to substitute garlic salt for the regular salt. Delicious!!
My families favorite Summer dressing

I cook for a pre-school, and the kids all loved this! I made a few changes to make it more kid-friendly. I used lemon juice instead of vinegar (I added a few tablespoons later to give it more zing). I didn't have mustard powder on hand to I used prepared yellow mustard (French's) instead. I also added 2 cloves of garlic and substituted Italian seasoning for poppy seeds. It has become a staff and student favorite!

This is definitely my kind of dressing! I really liked it and will definitely make it again! I made the full amount and stored the rest in a jar in the fridge for later use, then popped in the microwave to take the chill off,mmm! Delicious!
Made as written and loved it. Made it for company and they loved it as well. Served with baby spinach, strawberries and sliced almonds.

I found it to be far too vinegary and runny.
I used half EV olive oil and half vegetable oil and apple cider vinegar. Delish!

This is delicious I actually did not have white vinegar so I had to use a combination of apple cider and red wine vinegar, the taste was still a bit more tangy so I added about 2 more tbs of sugar. Perfect addition to any salad. The poppy seeds were a hit and it was very fresh and tangy.

Some variations were using onion powder in place of grated onion, olive oil in place of vegetable oil, half the oil, stevia in place of sugar, regular mustard in place of dry mustard, and omitted poppyseeds, added pepper. It's great no matter what. It seems like every time we go to make it we don't have everything and hand and have to substitute something.

Loved it!!
